title.rendered: OWC delighted to sponsor the BCCT Green Energy awards

content.rendered:
The Fourth Annual BCCT Better Business Awards is being held on the 30th of September 2020, and OWC is delighted to be sponsoring the Green Energy award on the night.

This year’s awards will be presented at a glamorous Awards Dinner, with an informative keynote to celebrate Responsible Companies and their positive impact on the world.

OWC’s Taiwan Country Manager Tom Whittle is judging and will be attending the event with geotechnical engineer George Marling. We will also have a booth at the event so you can easily find us for a chat. 

If you with register for this glamorous event, please click here.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar shortlisted for Energy Transition award
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has been shortlisted for EIC's Energy Transition Award in their annual EIC Awards. The award recognises companies that contribute or demonstrate the next wave of technologies, beyond wind and solar, that will deliver the 2050 net-zero carbon goals of the UK.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Energy Global Winter Issue 2020 publishes article by OWC
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC’s APAC director Tom Whittle and Cables expert Daniele Caruso jointly tackle floating wind in the Winter 2020 edition of the Energy Global magazine.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC appoints head of Asia Pacific region
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Following a substantial regional expansion in Asia over recent years, international offshore wind consultancy firm OWC has appointed Tom Whittle to its newly created role of Asia Pacific regional director. In 2018, OWC opened its first Asia Pacific office in Taiwan. Today, the company also has offices in South Korea…

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC reaches 50 GW milestone
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Following recent project awards in Taiwan, the US and the UK, OWC has reached the impressive milestone of being involved in more than 50 GW of offshore wind projects since the company’s inception in 2011.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Q3 2020 financial results
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: “In line with normal seasonality, the third quarter of 2020 was less active than previous quarters. Regardless, the business continues to show growth and improved profitability relative to the same period last year.”

jetpack-related-posts.title: South Korea next for OWC
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC has decided to set up an office in South Korea in order to support the country’s ambitious offshore wind plans. Industry senior NJ Park has been appointed OWC’s country manager.
